title: Race condition causing hang in vfs.readAt()
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
rclone mount stops responding and hangs indefinitely. Killing rclone when this happens reveals the following stack:

```
goroutine 8157 [sync.Cond.Wait, 79 minutes]:
runtime.goparkunlock(...)
      /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:310
sync.runtime_notifyListWait(0xc00008e210, 0x16d)
      /usr/local/go/src/runtime/sema.go:510 +0xf8
sync.(*Cond).Wait(0xc00008e200)
      /usr/local/go/src/sync/cond.go:56 +0x8e
github.com/rclone/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).readAt(0xc000606000, 0xc0001f6000, 0x2000, 0x2000, 0x298b2a000, 0xc0001f6000, 0x17, 0x4)
      /go/rclone/vfs/read.go:253 +0x1dd
github.com/rclone/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).ReadAt(0xc000606000, 0xc0001f6000, 0x2000, 0x2000, 0x298b2a000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
      /go/rclone/vfs/read.go:213 +0xec
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.(*FileHandle).Read(0xc00057e240, 0x2a18ce0, 0xc0000aa4c0, 0xc0001222a0, 0xc000682200, 0x1, 0xc000237100)
      /go/rclone/cmd/mount/handle.go:29 +0x3eb
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).handleRequest(0xc0002e23c0, 0x2a18ce0, 0xc0000aa4c0, 0x29e9f40, 0xc0003198c8, 0xc0000aaac0, 0x2a0fba0, 0xc0001222a0, 0xc000273ec0, 0xc00036ce58, ...)
      /root/go/pkg/mod/bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20191225233854-3a99aca11732/fs/serve.go:1246 +0xe14
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).serve(0xc0002e23c0, 0x2a0fba0, 0xc0001222a0)
      /root/go/pkg/mod/bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20191225233854-3a99aca11732/fs/serve.go:875 +0x54c
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve.func1(0xc0002e23c0, 0x2a0fba0, 0xc0001222a0)
      /root/go/pkg/mod/bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20191225233854-3a99aca11732/fs/serve.go:424 +0x8a
created by bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve
      /root/go/pkg/mod/bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20191225233854-3a99aca11732/fs/serve.go:422 +0x602
 
goroutine 8112 [select, 79 minutes]:
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/asyncreader.(*AsyncReader).init.func1(0xc0000e4000)
      /go/rclone/fs/asyncreader/asyncreader.go:83 +0x1e2
created by github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/asyncreader.(*AsyncReader).init
      /go/rclone/fs/asyncreader/asyncreader.go:78 +0x293
```

I believe this is because there is a race condition in the following section of code:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/5ee24f804f0058d33da4ebee2235a53508f770e5/vfs/read.go#L238-L255

If `timeout` fires before it gets down to `fh.cond.Wait()` on line 254, I believe it will be stuck waiting for a broadcast that will never occur.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.51.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.13.7
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 16.04 64 bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Cloud Storage

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount my-container: myfolder/`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

N/A
